member.summary: Option used with monitor APIs.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.MonitorOption.MONITOR_DEFAULTTONULL
member.summary: Returns NULL.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.MonitorOption.MONITOR_DEFAULTTOPRIMARY
member.summary: Returns a handle to the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.MonitorOption.MONITOR_DEFAULTTONEAREST
member.summary: Returns a handle to the display monitor that is nearest to the window.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.API.PeekMessageOptions
member.summary: Options for PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.PeekMessageOptions.PM_NOREMOVE
member.summary: Messages are not removed from the queue after processing by PeekMessage.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.PeekMessageOptions.PM_REMOVE
member.summary: Messages are removed from the queue after processing by PeekMessage.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.PeekMessageOptions.PM_NOYIELD
member.summary: Prevents the system from releasing any thread that is waiting for the caller to go idle. Combine this value with either PM_NOREMOVE or PM_REMOVE.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags
member.summary: Flags for RedrawWindow function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_INVALIDATE
member.summary: Invalidates lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate (only one may be non-NULL). If both are NULL, the entire window is invalidated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_INTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Causes a WM_PAINT message to be posted to the window regardless of whether any portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_ERASE
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_VALIDATE
member.summary: Validates lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate (only one may be non-NULL). If both are NULL, the entire window is validated. This flag does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOINTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Suppresses any pending internal WM_PAINT messages. This flag does not affect WM_PAINT messages resulting from a non-NULL update area.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOERASE
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_ALLCHILDREN
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_UPDATENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT, WM_ERASEBKGND, and WM_PAINT messages, if necessary, before the function returns.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_ERASENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT and WM_ERASEBKGND messages, if necessary, before the function returns. WM_PAINT messages are received at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_FRAME
member.summary: Causes any part of the nonclient area of the window that intersects the update region to receive a WM_NCPAINT message. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_FRAME has no effect. The WM_NCPAINT message is typically not sent during the execution of RedrawWindow unless either RDW_UPDATENOW or RDW_ERASENOW is specified.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.RedrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOFRAME
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_NCPAINT messages. This flag must be used with RDW_VALIDATE and is typically used with RDW_NOCHILDREN. RDW_NOFRAME should be used with care, as it could cause parts of a window to be painted improperly.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.API.Shell32
member.summary: API methods in shell32.dll.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.Shell32.SHAppBarMessage(CommonWin32.Shells.AppBarMessage,CommonWin32.Shells.APPBARDATA@)
member.summary: Sends an appbar message to the system.
member.param: Appbar message value to send.
A pointer to an APPBARDATA structure. The content of the structure on entry and on exit depends on the value set in the dwMessage parameter. See the individual message pages for specifics.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.Shell32.ExtractAssociatedIcon(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to an indexed icon found in a file or an icon found in an associated executable file.
member.param: A handle to the instance of the application calling the function.
The full path and file name of the file that contains the icon. The function extracts the icon handle from that file, or from an executable file associated with that file.
The index of the icon whose handle is to be obtained. If the icon handle is obtained from an executable file, the function stores the icon's identifier in this parameter.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is an icon handle.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.Shell32.ExtractIconEx(System.String,System.Int32,System.IntPtr[],System.IntPtr[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an array of handles to large or small icons extracted from the specified executable file, DLL, or icon file.
member.param: The name of an executable file, DLL, or icon file from which icons will be extracted.
The zero-based index of the first icon to extract.
An array of icon handles that receives handles to the large icons extracted from the file. If this parameter is NULL, no large icons are extracted from the file.
An array of icon handles that receives handles to the small icons extracted from the file. If this parameter is NULL, no small icons are extracted from the file.
The number of icons to be extracted from the file.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.Shell32.SHGetFileInfo(System.String,CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes,CommonWin32.Shells.SHFILEINFO@,System.UInt32,CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves information about an object in the file system, such as a file, folder, directory, or drive root.
member.param: The path and file name. Both absolute and relative paths are valid.
A combination of one or more file attribute flags.
A SHFILEINFO structure to receive the file information.
The size, in bytes, of the SHFILEINFO structure pointed to by the psfi parameter.
The flags that specify the file information to retrieve.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags
member.summary: Flags for .

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_ADDOVERLAYS
member.summary: Version 5.0. Apply the appropriate overlays to the file's icon. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_ATTR_SPECIFIED
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ATTRIBUTES to indicate that the dwAttributes member of the SHFILEINFO structure at psfi contains the specific attributes that are desired. These attributes are passed to IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf. If this flag is not specified, 0xFFFFFFFF is passed to IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf, requesting all attributes. This flag cannot be specified with the SHGFI_ICON flag.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Retrieve the item attributes. The attributes are copied to the dwAttributes member of the structure specified in the psfi parameter. These are the same attributes that are obtained from IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_DISPLAYNAME
member.summary: Retrieve the display name for the file, which is the name as it appears in Windows Explorer. The name is copied to the szDisplayName member of the structure specified in psfi. The returned display name uses the long file name, if there is one, rather than the 8.3 form of the file name. Note that the display name can be affected by settings such as whether extensions are shown.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_EXETYPE
member.summary: Retrieve the type of the executable file if pszPath identifies an executable file. The information is packed into the return value. This flag cannot be specified with any other flags.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_ICON
member.summary: Retrieve the handle to the icon that represents the file and the index of the icon within the system image list. The handle is copied to the hIcon member of the structure specified by psfi, and the index is copied to the iIcon member.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_ICONLOCATION
member.summary: Retrieve the name of the file that contains the icon representing the file specified by pszPath, as returned by the IExtractIcon::GetIconLocation method of the file's icon handler. Also retrieve the icon index within that file. The name of the file containing the icon is copied to the szDisplayName member of the structure specified by psfi. The icon's index is copied to that structure's iIcon member.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_LARGEICON
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve the file's large icon. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_LINKOVERLAY
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to add the link overlay to the file's icon. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_OPENICON
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve the file's open icon. Also used to modify SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX, causing the function to return the handle to the system image list that contains the file's small open icon. A container object displays an open icon to indicate that the container is open. The SHGFI_ICON and/or SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_OVERLAYINDEX
member.summary: Version 5.0. Return the index of the overlay icon. The value of the overlay index is returned in the upper eight bits of the iIcon member of the structure specified by psfi. This flag requires that the SHGFI_ICON be set as well.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_PIDL
member.summary: Indicate that pszPath is the address of an ITEMIDLIST structure rather than a path name.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_SELECTED
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to blend the file's icon with the system highlight color. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_SHELLICONSIZE
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve a Shell-sized icon. If this flag is not specified the function sizes the icon according to the system metric values. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_SMALLICON
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve the file's small icon. Also used to modify SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX, causing the function to return the handle to the system image list that contains small icon images. The SHGFI_ICON and/or SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX flag must also be set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX
member.summary: Retrieve the index of a system image list icon. If successful, the index is copied to the iIcon member of psfi. The return value is a handle to the system image list. Only those images whose indices are successfully copied to iIcon are valid. Attempting to access other images in the system image list will result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_TYPENAME
member.summary: Retrieve the string that describes the file's type. The string is copied to the szTypeName member of the structure specified in psfi.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.ShellFileFlags.SHGFI_USEFILEATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Indicates that the function should not attempt to access the file specified by pszPath. Rather, it should act as if the file specified by pszPath exists with the file attributes passed in dwFileAttributes. This flag cannot be combined with the SHGFI_ATTRIBUTES, SHGFI_EXETYPE, or SHGFI_PIDL flags.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric
member.summary: Codes for getting system metric values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels. This is the same value obtained by calling GetDeviceCaps as follows: GetDeviceCaps( hdcPrimaryMonitor, HORZRES).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels. This is the same value obtained by calling GetDeviceCaps as follows: GetDeviceCaps( hdcPrimaryMonitor, VERTRES).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXVSCROLL
member.summary: The width of a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYHSCROLL
member.summary: The height of a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYCAPTION
member.summary: The height of a caption area, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXBORDER
member.summary: The width of a window border, in pixels. This is equivalent to the SM_CXEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYBORDER
member.summary: The height of a window border, in pixels. This is equivalent to the SM_CYEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXDLGFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CXFIXEDFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYDLGFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CYFIXEDFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYVTHUMB
member.summary: The height of the thumb box in a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXHTHUMB
member.summary: The width of the thumb box in a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXICON
member.summary: The default width of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions that SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON specifies.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYICON
member.summary: The default height of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXCURSOR
member.summary: The width of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYCURSOR
member.summary: The height of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENU
member.summary: The height of a single-line menu bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXFULLSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels. To get the coordinates of the portion of the screen that is not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars, call the SystemParametersInfo function with the SPI_GETWORKAREA value.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYFULLSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels. To get the coordinates of the portion of the screen not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars, call the SystemParametersInfo function with the SPI_GETWORKAREA value.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYKANJIWINDOW
member.summary: For double byte character set versions of the system, this is the height of the Kanji window at the bottom of the screen, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse is installed; otherwise, 0. This value is rarely zero, because of support for virtual mice and because some systems detect the presence of the port instead of the presence of a mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYVSCROLL
member.summary: The height of the arrow bitmap on a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXHSCROLL
member.summary: The width of the arrow bitmap on a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_DEBUG
member.summary: Nonzero if the debug version of User.exe is installed; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SWAPBUTTON
member.summary: Nonzero if the meanings of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMIN
member.summary: The minimum width of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMIN
member.summary: The minimum height of a window, in pixels

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXSIZE
member.summary: The width of a button in a window caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYSIZE
member.summary: The height of a button in a window caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CXSIZEFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CYSIZEFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINTRACK
member.summary: The minimum tracking width of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINTRACK
member.summary: The minimum tracking height of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXDOUBLECLK
member.summary: The width of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle that is defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. The two clicks must also occur within a specified time. To set the width of the double-click rectangle, call SystemParametersInfo with SPI_SETDOUBLECLKWIDTH.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYDOUBLECLK
member.summary: The height of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. The two clicks must also occur within a specified time. To set the height of the double-click rectangle, call SystemParametersInfo with SPI_SETDOUBLECLKHEIGHT.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXICONSPACING
member.summary: The width of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXICON.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYICONSPACING
member.summary: The height of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MENUDROPALIGNMENT
member.summary: Nonzero if drop-down menus are right-aligned with the corresponding menu-bar item; 0 if the menus are left-aligned.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_PENWINDOWS
member.summary: Nonzero if the Microsoft Windows for Pen computing extensions are installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_DBCSENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if User32.dll supports DBCS; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CMOUSEBUTTONS
member.summary: The number of buttons on a mouse, or zero if no mouse is installed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXFIXEDFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels. SM_CXFIXEDFRAME is the height of the horizontal border, and SM_CYFIXEDFRAME is the width of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CXDLGFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYFIXEDFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels. SM_CXFIXEDFRAME is the height of the horizontal border, and SM_CYFIXEDFRAME is the width of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CYDLGFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. SM_CXSIZEFRAME is the width of the horizontal border, and SM_CYSIZEFRAME is the height of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CXFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. SM_CXSIZEFRAME is the width of the horizontal border, and SM_CYSIZEFRAME is the height of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CYFRAME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SECURE
member.summary: This system metric should be ignored; it always returns 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXEDGE
member.summary: The width of a 3-D border, in pixels. This metric is the 3-D counterpart of SM_CXBORDER.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYEDGE
member.summary: The height of a 3-D border, in pixels. This is the 3-D counterpart of SM_CYBORDER.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINSPACING
member.summary: The width of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels. Each minimized window fits into a rectangle this size when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXMINIMIZED.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINSPACING
member.summary: The height of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels. Each minimized window fits into a rectangle this size when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYMINIMIZED.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXSMICON
member.summary: The recommended width of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYSMICON
member.summary: The recommended height of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYSMCAPTION
member.summary: The height of a small caption, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXSMSIZE
member.summary: The width of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYSMSIZE
member.summary: The height of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMENUSIZE
member.summary: The width of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button that is used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENUSIZE
member.summary: The height of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button that is used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_ARRANGE
member.summary: The flags that specify how the system arranged minimized windows.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINIMIZED
member.summary: The width of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINIMIZED
member.summary: The height of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMAXTRACK
member.summary: The default maximum width of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels. This metric refers to the entire desktop. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size larger than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMAXTRACK
member.summary: The default maximum height of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels. This metric refers to the entire desktop. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size larger than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The default width, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The default height, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_NETWORK
member.summary: The least significant bit is set if a network is present; otherwise, it is cleared. The other bits are reserved for future use.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CLEANBOOT
member.summary: The value that specifies how the system is started

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXDRAG
member.summary: The number of pixels on either side of a mouse-down point that the mouse pointer can move before a drag operation begins. This allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation. If this value is negative, it is subtracted from the left of the mouse-down point and added to the right of it.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYDRAG
member.summary: The number of pixels above and below a mouse-down point that the mouse pointer can move before a drag operation begins. This allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation. If this value is negative, it is subtracted from above the mouse-down point and added below it.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SHOWSOUNDS
member.summary: Nonzero if the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXMENUCHECK
member.summary: The width of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENUCHECK
member.summary: The height of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SLOWMACHINE
member.summary: Nonzero if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MIDEASTENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, 0 if not.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a vertical scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the width of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the top of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the height of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the coordinates for the top of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CMONITORS
member.summary: The number of display monitors on a desktop. For more information, see the Remarks section in this topic.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SAMEDISPLAYFORMAT
member.summary: Nonzero if all the display monitors have the same color format, otherwise, 0. Two displays can have the same bit depth, but different color formats. For example, the red, green, and blue pixels can be encoded with different numbers of bits, or those bits can be located in different places in a pixel color value.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_IMMENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; otherwise, 0. SM_IMMENABLED indicates whether the system is ready to use a Unicode-based IME on a Unicode application. To ensure that a language-dependent IME works, check SM_DBCSENABLED and the system ANSI code page. Otherwise the ANSI-to-Unicode conversion may not be performed correctly, or some components like fonts or registry settings may not be present.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: The width of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle that the DrawFocusRect draws. This value is in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CYFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: The height of the top and bottom edges of the focus rectangle drawn by DrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_TABLETPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition or if the current operating system is Windows Vista or Windows 7 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The SM_DIGITIZER setting indicates the type of digitizer input supported by a device running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MEDIACENTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, 0 if not.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_STARTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 Starter Edition, Windows Vista Starter, or Windows XP Starter Edition; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SERVERR2
member.summary: The build number if the system is Windows Server 2003 R2; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEHORIZONTALWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a horizontal scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_CXPADDEDBORDER
member.summary: The amount of border padding for captioned windows, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_DIGITIZER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The return value is a bitmask that specifies the type of digitizer input supported by the device.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES
member.summary: Nonzero if there are digitizers in the system; otherwise, 0. SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES returns the aggregate maximum of the maximum number of contacts supported by every digitizer in the system. If the system has only single-touch digitizers, the return value is 1. If the system has multi-touch digitizers, the return value is the number of simultaneous contacts the hardware can provide.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTESESSION
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Services console session, the return value is 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_SHUTTINGDOWN
member.summary: Nonzero if the current session is shutting down; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTECONTROL
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment to determine if the current Terminal Server session is being remotely controlled. Its value is nonzero if the current session is remotely controlled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.API.User32
member.summary: API methods in user32.dll.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.GetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.WindowClasses.WindowLong)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
Index of the value.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.WindowClasses.WindowLong,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets a value at the specified offset in the extra window memory.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
The zero-based offset to the value to be set.
The replacement value.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified offset. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.GetClassLong(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.WindowClasses.ClassLong)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified value from the WNDCLASSEX structure associated with the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
Index of the value.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SetClassLong(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.WindowClasses.ClassLong,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Replaces the specified value at the specified offset in the extra class memory or the WNDCLASSEX structure for the class to which the specified window belongs.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
The zero-based offset to the value to be set.
The replacement value.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified offset. If this was not previously set, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SetForegroundWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Brings the thread that created the specified window into the foreground and activates the window. Keyboard input is directed to the window, and various visual cues are changed for the user. The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that created the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.param: A handle to the window that should be activated and brought to the foreground.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SetParent(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes the parent window of the specified child window.
member.param: A handle to the child window.
A handle to the new parent window. If this parameter is NULL, the desktop window becomes the new parent window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the previous parent window.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.DestroyIcon(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Destroys an icon and frees any memory the icon occupied.
member.param: A handle to the icon to be destroyed. The icon must not be in use.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.PostMessage(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Places (posts) a message in the message queue associated with the thread that created the specified window and returns without waiting for the thread to process the message.
member.param: A handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST ((HWND)0xffff), the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
The message to be sent.
Additional message-specific information.
Additional message-specific information.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows.
member.param: A handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message.
The message to be sent.
Additional message-specific information.
Additional message-specific information.
member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing; it depends on the message sent.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.DefWindowProc(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Calls the default window procedure to provide default processing for any window messages that an application does not process. This function ensures that every message is processed. DefWindowProc is called with the same parameters received by the window procedure.
member.param: A handle to the window procedure that received the message.
The message.
Additional message information. The content of this parameter depends on the value of the Msg parameter.
Additional message information. The content of this parameter depends on the value of the Msg parameter.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a child, pop-up, or top-level window. These windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen. The topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.
member.param: A handle to the window.
A handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the Z order. This parameter must be a window handle or one of the HWndValues.
The new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
The new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.
The window sizing and positioning flags.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.GetSystemMetrics(CommonWin32.API.SystemMetric)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified system metric or system configuration setting.
member.param: The metric.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.MonitorFromWindow(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.API.MonitorOption)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window of interest.
Determines the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display monitor.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.MonitorFromRect(CommonWin32.Rectangles.RECT@,CommonWin32.API.MonitorOption)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with a specified rectangle.
member.param: RECT structure that specifies the rectangle of interest in virtual-screen coordinates.
Determines the function's return value if the rectangle does not intersect any display monitor.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.GetMonitorInfo(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.Monitors.MONITORINFO@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a display monitor.
member.param: A handle to the display monitor of interest.
A MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. This function does not search child windows. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search. To search child windows, beginning with a specified child window, use the FindWindowEx function.
member.param: Name of the lp class.
Name of the lp window.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.SetWindowRgn(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The SetWindowRgn function sets the window region of a window. The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing. The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region
member.param: A handle to the window whose window region is to be set.
A handle to a region. The function sets the window region of the window to this region.

Specifies whether the system redraws the window after setting the window region. If bRedraw is TRUE, the system does so; otherwise, it does not. Typically, you set bRedraw to TRUE if the window is visible.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window.
The WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that receives the show state and position information. Before calling GetWindowPlacement, set the length member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT).

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.IsWindowVisible(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines the visibility state of the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window to be tested.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.API.User32.GetWindowRect(System.IntPtr,CommonWin32.Rectangles.RECT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.
member.param: A handle to the window.
RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes
member.summary: File attributes are metadata values stored by the file system on disk and are used by the system and are available to developers via various file I/O APIs.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE
member.summary: A file or directory that is an archive file or directory. Applications typically use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal .

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_COMPRESSED
member.summary: A file or directory that is compressed. For a file, all of the data in the file is compressed. For a directory, compression is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DEVICE
member.summary: This value is reserved for system use.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY
member.summary: The handle that identifies a directory.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ENCRYPTED
member.summary: A file or directory that is encrypted. For a file, all data streams in the file are encrypted. For a directory, encryption is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN
member.summary: The file or directory is hidden. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_INTEGRITY_STREAM
member.summary: The directory or user data stream is configured with integrity=only supported on ReFS volumes,. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing. The integrity setting persists with the file if it's renamed. If a file is copied the destination file will have integrity set if either the source file or destination directory have integrity set. Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This flag is not supported until Windows Server 2012.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL
member.summary: A file that does not have other attributes set. This attribute is valid only when used alone.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_CONTENT_INDEXED
member.summary: The file or directory is not to be indexed by the content indexing service.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NO_SCRUB_DATA
member.summary: The user data stream not to be read by the background data integrity scanner=AKA scrubber,. When set on a directory it only provides inheritance. This flag is only supported on Storage Spaces and ReFS volumes. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing. Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This flag is not supported until Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE
member.summary: The data of a file is not available immediately. This attribute indicates that the file data is physically moved to offline storage. This attribute is used by Remote Storage, which is the hierarchical storage management software. Applications should not arbitrarily change this attribute.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY
member.summary: A file that is read-only. Applications can read the file, but cannot write to it or delete it. This attribute is not honored on directories. For more information, see You cannot view or change the Read-only or the System attributes of folders in Windows Server 2003, in Windows XP, in Windows Vista or in Windows 7.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_REPARSE_POINT
member.summary: A file or directory that has an associated reparse point, or a file that is a symbolic link.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SPARSE_FILE
member.summary: A file that is a sparse file.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM
member.summary: A file or directory that the operating system uses a part of, or uses exclusively.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY
member.summary: A file that is being used for temporary storage. File systems avoid writing data back to mass storage if sufficient cache memory is available, because typically, an application deletes a temporary file after the handle is closed. In that scenario, the system can entirely avoid writing the data. Otherwise, the data is written after the handle is closed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.FileManagement.FileAttributes.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_VIRTUAL
member.summary: This value is reserved for system use.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL
member.summary: The CREDENTIAL structure contains an individual credential.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.Flags
member.summary: A bit member that identifies characteristics of the credential. Undefined bits should be initialized as zero and not otherwise altered to permit future enhancement.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.Type
member.summary: The type of the credential. This member cannot be changed after the credential is created.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.TargetName
member.summary: The name of the credential. The TargetName and Type members uniquely identify the credential. This member cannot be changed after the credential is created. Instead, the credential with the old name should be deleted and the credential with the new name created. This member cannot be longer than CRED_MAX_GENERIC_TARGET_NAME_LENGTH characters.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.Comment
member.summary: A string comment from the user that describes this credential. This member cannot be longer than CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.LastWritten
member.summary: The time, in Coordinated Universal Time (Greenwich Mean Time), of the last modification of the credential. For write operations, the value of this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CredentialBlobSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the CredentialBlob member. This member cannot be larger than CRED_MAX_CREDENTIAL_BLOB_SIZE bytes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CredentialBlob
member.summary: Secret data for the credential. The CredentialBlob member can be both read and written.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.Persist
member.summary: Defines the persistence of this credential. This member can be read and written.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.AttributeCount
member.summary: The number of application-defined attributes to be associated with the credential. This member can be read and written. Its value cannot be greater than CRED_MAX_ATTRIBUTES.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.Attributes
member.summary: Application-defined attributes that are associated with the credential. This member can be read and written.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.TargetAlias
member.summary: Alias for the TargetName member. This member can be read and written. It cannot be longer than CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH characters.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.UserName
member.summary: The user name of the account used to connect to TargetName. This member cannot be longer than CRED_MAX_USERNAME_LENGTH characters.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_CREDENTIAL_BLOB_SIZE
member.summary: Maximum size of the CredBlob field (in bytes)

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_GENERIC_TARGET_NAME_LENGTH
member.summary: Maximum length of the TargetName field for CRED_TYPE_GENERIC (in characters)

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH
member.summary: Maximum length of the various credential string fields (in characters)

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_USERNAME_LENGTH
member.summary: Maximum length of the UserName field. The worst case is User@DnsDomain

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_DOMAIN_TARGET_NAME_LENGTH
member.summary: Maximum length of the TargetName field for CRED_TYPE_DOMAIN_* (in characters). Largest one is DfsRoot\DfsShare.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_TARGETNAME_NAMESPACE_LENGTH
member.summary: Maximum length of a target namespace.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_TARGETNAME_ATTRIBUTE_LENGTH
member.summary: Maximum length of a target attribute.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_VALUE_SIZE
member.summary: Maximum size of the Credential Attribute Value field (in bytes).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CREDENTIAL.CRED_MAX_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Maximum number of attributes per credential.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialFlags.CRED_FLAGS_PROMPT_NOW
member.summary: Bit set if the credential does not persist the CredentialBlob and the credential has not been written during this logon session. This bit is ignored on input and is set automatically when queried.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialFlags.CRED_FLAGS_USERNAME_TARGET
member.summary: Bit is set if this credential has a TargetName member set to the same value as the UserName member. Such a credential is one designed to store the CredentialBlob for a specific user.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialFlags.CRED_FLAGS_WILDCARD_MATCH
member.summary: Valid only for return and only with CredReadDomainCredentials(). Indicates credential was returned due to wildcard match of targetname with credential.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialFlags.CRED_FLAGS_VALID_FLAGS
member.summary: Mask of all valid flags

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialFlags.CRED_FLAGS_VALID_INPUT_FLAGS
member.summary: Bit mask for only those flags which can be passed to the credman APIs.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_GENERIC
member.summary: The credential is a generic credential. The credential will not be used by any particular authentication package. The credential will be stored securely but has no other significant characteristics.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_DOMAIN_PASSWORD
member.summary: The credential is a password credential and is specific to Microsoft's authentication packages. The NTLM, Kerberos, and Negotiate authentication packages will automatically use this credential when connecting to the named target.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_DOMAIN_CERTIFICATE
member.summary: The credential is a certificate credential and is specific to Microsoft's authentication packages. The Kerberos, Negotiate, and Schannel authentication packages automatically use this credential when connecting to the named target.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_DOMAIN_VISIBLE_PASSWORD
member.summary: This value is no longer supported.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_GENERIC_CERTIFICATE
member.summary: The credential is a certificate credential that is a generic authentication package.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_DOMAIN_EXTENDED
member.summary: The credential is supported by extended Negotiate packages.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_MAXIMUM
member.summary: The maximum number of supported credential types.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.CredentialType.CRED_TYPE_MAXIMUM_EX
member.summary: The extended maximum number of supported credential types that now allow new applications to run on older operating systems.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.PersistType.CRED_PERSIST_SESSION
member.summary: The credential persists for the life of the logon session. It will not be visible to other logon sessions of this same user. It will not exist after this user logs off and back on.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.PersistType.CRED_PERSIST_LOCAL_MACHINE
member.summary: The credential persists for all subsequent logon sessions on this same computer. It is visible to other logon sessions of this same user on this same computer and not visible to logon sessions for this user on other computers.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Authentication.PersistType.CRED_PERSIST_ENTERPRISE
member.summary: The credential persists for all subsequent logon sessions on this same computer. It is visible to other logon sessions of this same user on this same computer and to logon sessions for this user on other computers. This option can be implemented as locally persisted credential if the administrator or user configures the user account to not have roam-able state. For instance, if the user has no roaming profile, the credential will only persist locally.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.BasicValues
member.summary: Contains basic win32 values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.BasicValues.TRUE
member.summary: Represents the TRUE value as .

member.name: F:CommonWin32.BasicValues.FALSE
member.summary: Represents the FALSE value as .

member.name: F:CommonWin32.BasicValues.MAX_PATH
member.summary: The max file path length.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFO
member.summary: Defines the dimensions and color information for a DIB.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFO.bmiHeader
member.summary: Structure that contains information about the dimensions of color format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFO.bmiColors
member.summary: This contains one of the following: 1. An array of RGBQUAD. The elements of the array that make up the color table. 2. An array of 16-bit unsigned integers that specifies indexes into the currently realized logical palette. This use of bmiColors is allowed for functions that use DIBs. The number of entries in the array depends on the values of the biBitCount and biClrUsed members of the BITMAPINFOHEADER structure.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER
member.summary: Structure that contains information about the dimensions and color format of a DIB.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biSize
member.summary: The number of bytes required by the structure.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biWidth
member.summary: The width of the bitmap, in pixels. If Compression is JPEG or PNG, the Width member specifies the width of the decompressed JPEG or PNG image file, respectively.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biHeight
member.summary: The height of the bitmap, in pixels. If Height is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner. If Height is negative, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner. If Height is negative, indicating a top-down DIB, Compression must be either RGB or BITFIELDS. Top-down DIBs cannot be compressed. If Compression is JPEG or PNG, the Height member specifies the height of the decompressed JPEG or PNG image file, respectively.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biPlanes
member.summary: The number of planes for the target device. This value must be set to 1.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biBitCount
member.summary: The number of bits-per-pixel. The BitCount member determines the number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in the bitmap.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biCompression
member.summary: The type of compression for a compressed bottom-up bitmap (top-down DIBs cannot be compressed).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biSizeImage
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the image. This may be set to zero for RGB bitmaps. If Compression is JPEG or PNG, SizeImage indicates the size of the JPEG or PNG image buffer, respectively.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biXPelsPerMeter
member.summary: The horizontal resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the bitmap. An application can use this value to select a bitmap from a resource group that best matches the characteristics of the current device.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biYPelsPerMeter
member.summary: The vertical resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the bitmap.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biClrUsed
member.summary: The number of color indexes in the color table that are actually used by the bitmap. If this value is zero, the bitmap uses the maximum number of colors corresponding to the value of the BitCount member for the compression mode specified by Compression.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biClrImportant
member.summary: The number of color indexes that are required for displaying the bitmap. If this value is zero, all colors are required.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetXDpi
member.summary: Gets the horizontal dpi of the bitmap.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetYDpi
member.summary: Gets the vertical dpi of the bitmap.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetByteSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the structure.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.Validate
member.summary: Checks to see if this structure contain valid data. It also fills in any missing pieces if possible.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetScan0(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the pointer to scan0 given the header pointer.
member.param: The header PTR.

member.name: P:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.IsBottomUpImage
member.summary: Gets whether the bitmap is bottom-up or top-down format.
member.value: true if this instance is bottom up image; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetDrawingPixelFormat
member.summary: Gets the System.Drawing pixel format of current structure.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetDrawingPalette(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the color palette that's contained in the header. Note not all images will have palette, so check if the return value is null before using it.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.GetStride
member.summary: Gets the stride size of this bitmap.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType
member.summary: Indicates the bitmap compression of .

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType.BI_RGB
member.summary: An uncompressed format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType.BI_RLE8
member.summary: A run-length encoded (RLE) format for bitmaps with 8 bpp. The compression format is a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by a byte containing a color index. For more information, see Bitmap Compression.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType.BI_RLE4
member.summary: An RLE, format for bitmaps with 4 bpp. The compression format is a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by two word-length color indexes. For more information, see Bitmap Compression.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType.BI_BITFIELDS
member.summary: Specifies that the bitmap is not compressed and that the color table consists of three DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, and blue components of each pixel. This is valid when used with 16- and 32-bpp bitmaps.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType.BI_JPEG
member.summary: Indicates that the image is a JPEG image.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BITMAPINFOHEADER.CompressionType.BI_PNG
member.summary: Indicates that the image is a PNG image.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION
member.summary: This structure controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.BlendOp
member.summary: Specifies the source blend operation. Currently, the only source and destination blend operation that has been defined is AC_SRC_OVER. For details, see the following Remarks section.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.BlendFlags
member.summary: Must be zero.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.SourceConstantAlpha
member.summary: Specifies an alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap. The SourceConstantAlpha value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap. If you set SourceConstantAlpha to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent. When you only want to use per-pixel alpha values, set the SourceConstantAlpha value to 255 (opaque) .

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.AlphaFormat
member.summary: This member controls the way the source and destination bitmaps are interpreted.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.Format
member.summary: Indicates the blend alpha format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.Format.AC_SRC_OVER
member.summary: The source bitmap is placed over the destination bitmap based on the alpha values of the source pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.BLENDFUNCTION.Format.AC_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: This flag is set when the bitmap has an Alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha).

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.RGBQUAD
member.summary: Describes a color consisting of relative intensities of red, green, and blue.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.RGBQUAD.rgbBlue
member.summary: The intensity of blue in the color.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.RGBQUAD.rgbGreen
member.summary: The intensity of green in the color.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.RGBQUAD.rgbRed
member.summary: The intensity of red in the color.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.RGBQUAD.rgbReserved
member.summary: This member is reserved and must be zero.

member.summary: Specifies the rectangle's width. The units depend on which function uses this.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Bitmaps.SIZE.cy
member.summary: Specifies the rectangle's height. The units depend on which function uses this.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ComboBoxControl.COMBOBOXINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the structure. The calling application must set this to sizeof(COMBOBOXINFO).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ComboBoxControl.COMBOBOXINFO.rcItem

member.name: T:CommonWin32.HighDPI.MONITOR_DPI_TYPE
member.summary: Identifies the dots per inch (dpi) setting for a monitor.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.MONITOR_DPI_TYPE.MDT_EFFECTIVE_DPI
member.summary: The effective DPI. This value should be used when determining the correct scale factor for scaling UI elements. This incorporates the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.MONITOR_DPI_TYPE.MDT_ANGULAR_DPI
member.summary: The angular DPI. This DPI ensures rendering at a compliant angular resolution on the screen. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.MONITOR_DPI_TYPE.MDT_RAW_DPI
member.summary: The raw DPI. This value is the linear DPI of the screen as measured on the screen itself. Use this value when you want to read the pixel density and not the recommended scaling setting. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display and is not guaranteed to be a supported DPI value.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.MONITOR_DPI_TYPE.MDT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Same as .

member.name: T:CommonWin32.HighDPI.PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS
member.summary: Identifies dots per inch (dpi) awareness values. DPI awareness indicates how much scaling work an application performs for DPI versus how much is done by the system.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS.PROCESS_DPI_UNAWARE
member.summary: DPI unaware. This app does not scale for DPI changes and is always assumed to have a scale factor of 100% (96 DPI). It will be automatically scaled by the system on any other DPI setting.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS.PROCESS_SYSTEM_DPI_AWARE
member.summary: System DPI aware. This app does not scale for DPI changes. It will query for the DPI once and use that value for the lifetime of the app. If the DPI changes, the app will not adjust to the new DPI value. It will be automatically scaled up or down by the system when the DPI changes from the system value.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.HighDPI.PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS.PROCESS_PER_MONITOR_DPI_AWARE
member.summary: Per monitor DPI aware. This app checks for the DPI when it is created and adjusts the scale factor whenever the DPI changes. These applications are not automatically scaled by the system.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.HighDPI.SHELL_UI_COMPONENT
member.summary: Identifies the type of UI component that is needed in the shell.

member.summary: This UI component is an icon in the notification area.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS
member.summary: Contains information about an image list draw operation and is used with the IImageList::Draw function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.cbSize
member.summary: The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.himl
member.summary: A handle to the image list that contains the image to be drawn.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.i
member.summary: The zero-based index of the image to be drawn.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.hdcDst
member.summary: A handle to the destination device context.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.x
member.summary: The x-coordinate that specifies where the image is drawn.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.y
member.summary: The y-coordinate that specifies where the image is drawn.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.cx
member.summary: A value that specifies the number of pixels to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the drawing operation as specified by xBitmap and yBitmap. If cx and cy are zero, then Draw draws the entire valid section. The method does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.cy
member.summary: A value that specifies the number of pixels to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the drawing operation as specified by xBitmap and yBitmap. If cx and cy are zero, then Draw draws the entire valid section. The method does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.xBitmap
member.summary: The x-coordinate that specifies the upper-left corner of the drawing operation in reference to the image itself. Pixels of the image that are to the left of xBitmap and above yBitmap do not appear.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.yBitmap
member.summary: The y-coordinate that specifies the upper-left corner of the drawing operation in reference to the image itself. Pixels of the image that are to the left of xBitmap and above yBitmap do not appear.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.rgbBk
member.summary: The image background color. This parameter can also be an application-defined RGB value.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.rgbFg
member.summary: The image foreground color. This member is used only if fStyle includes the ILD_BLEND25 or ILD_BLEND50 flag.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.fStyle
member.summary: A flag specifying the drawing style and, optionally, the overlay image.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.dwRop
member.summary: A value specifying a raster operation code. These codes define how the color data for the source rectangle will be combined with the color data for the destination rectangle to achieve the final color. This member is ignored if fStyle does not include the ILD_ROP flag.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.fState
member.summary: A flag that specifies the drawing state.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.Frame
member.summary: Used with the alpha blending effect.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ImageLists.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.crEffect
member.summary: A color used for the glow and shadow effects.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_LEFT
member.summary: Text is left-aligned.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_RIGHT
member.summary: Text is right-aligned.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_CENTER
member.summary: Text is centered.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_JUSTIFYMASK
member.summary: A bitmask used to select those bits of fmt that control field justification. To check the format of a column, use a logical "and" to combine LCFMT_JUSTIFYMASK with fmt. You can then use a switch statement to determine whether the LVCFMT_LEFT, LVCFMT_RIGHT, or LVCFMT_CENTER bits are set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_IMAGE
member.summary: The item displays an image from an image list.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_BITMAP_ON_RIGHT
member.summary: The bitmap appears to the right of text. This does not affect an image from an image list assigned to the header item.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_COL_HAS_IMAGES
member.summary: The header item contains an image in the image list.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.HDF_SORTUP
member.summary: Show sort ascending indicator in header.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.HDF_SORTDOWN
member.summary: Show sort descending indicator in header.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_LINE_BREAK
member.summary: Forces the column to wrap to the top of the next list of columns.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_FILL
member.summary: Fills the remainder of the tile area. Might have a title.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_WRAP
member.summary: Allows the column to wrap within the remaining space in its list of columns.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_NO_TITLE
member.summary: Removes the title from the subitem.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.ColumnFormats.LVCFMT_TILE_PLACEMENTMASK
member.summary: Equivalent to a combination of LVCFMT_LINE_BREAK and LVCFMT_FILL.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN
member.summary: Contains information about a column in report view.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.mask
member.summary: Variable specifying which members contain valid information

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.fmt
member.summary: Alignment of the column header and the subitem text in the column. The alignment of the leftmost column is always LVCFMT_LEFT; it cannot be changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.cx
member.summary: Width of the column, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.pszText
member.summary: String of the column header.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.ccTextMax
member.summary: Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszText member. If the structure is not receiving information about a column, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.iSubItem
member.summary: Index of subitem associated with the column.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.iImage
member.summary: Zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will appear within the column.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN.iOrder
member.summary: Zero-based column offset. Column offset is in left-to-right order. For example, zero indicates the leftmost column.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN_VISTA
member.summary: Contains information about a column in report view.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this struct is supported on current platform.

member.summary: Variable specifying which members contain valid information

member.summary: Alignment of the column header and the subitem text in the column. The alignment of the leftmost column is always LVCFMT_LEFT; it cannot be changed.

member.summary: Width of the column, in pixels.

member.summary: String of the column header.

member.summary: Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszText member. If the structure is not receiving information about a column, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN_VISTA.iSubItem
member.summary: Index of subitem associated with the column.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN_VISTA.iImage
member.summary: Zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will appear within the column.

member.summary: Zero-based column offset. Column offset is in left-to-right order. For example, zero indicates the leftmost column.

member.summary: Windows Vista. Minimum width of the column in pixels.

member.summary: Windows Vista. Application-defined value typically used to store the default width of the column. This member is ignored by the list-view control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVCOLUMN_VISTA.cxIdeal
member.summary: Windows Vista. Read-only. The ideal width of the column in pixels, as the column may currently be autosized to a lesser width.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this struct is supported on current platform.

member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.mask
member.summary: Mask that specifies which members of the structure are valid input. One or more of the following values:LVGF_NONENo other items are valid.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.pszHeader
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the header text when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the header text.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.cchHeader
member.summary: Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszHeader member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the footer text when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the footer text.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.cchFooter
member.summary: Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszFooter member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.iGroupId
member.summary: ID of the group.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.stateMask
member.summary: Mask used with LVM_GETGROUPINFO (Microsoft Windows XP and Windows Vista) and LVM_SETGROUPINFO (Windows Vista only) to specify which flags in the state value are being retrieved or set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.state
member.summary: Flag that can have one of the following values:LVGS_NORMALGroups are expanded, the group name is displayed, and all items in the group are displayed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP.uAlign
member.summary: Indicates the alignment of the header or footer text for the group. It can have one or more of the following values. Use one of the header flags. Footer flags are optional. Windows XP: Footer flags are reserved.LVGA_FOOTER_CENTERReserved.
