member.summary: Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszFooter member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.iGroupId
member.summary: ID of the group.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.stateMask
member.summary: Mask used with LVM_GETGROUPINFO (Microsoft Windows XP and Windows Vista) and LVM_SETGROUPINFO (Windows Vista only) to specify which flags in the state value are being retrieved or set.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.state
member.summary: Flag that can have one of the following values:LVGS_NORMALGroups are expanded, the group name is displayed, and all items in the group are displayed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.uAlign
member.summary: Indicates the alignment of the header or footer text for the group. It can have one or more of the following values. Use one of the header flags. Footer flags are optional. Windows XP: Footer flags are reserved.LVGA_FOOTER_CENTERReserved.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.pszSubtitle
member.summary: Windows Vista. Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the subtitle text when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the subtitle text. This element is drawn under the header text.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.cchSubtitle
member.summary: Windows Vista. Size, in TCHARs, of the buffer pointed to by the pszSubtitle member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.pszTask
member.summary: Windows Vista. Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the text for a task link when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the task text. This item is drawn right-aligned opposite the header text. When clicked by the user, the task link generates an LVN_LINKCLICK notification.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.cchTask
member.summary: Windows Vista. Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszTask member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.pszDescriptionTop
member.summary: Windows Vista. Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the top description text when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the top description text. This item is drawn opposite the title image when there is a title image, no extended image, and uAlign==LVGA_HEADER_CENTER.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.cchDescriptionTop
member.summary: Windows Vista. Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszDescriptionTop member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.pszDescriptionBottom
member.summary: Windows Vista. Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the bottom description text when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the bottom description text. This item is drawn under the top description text when there is a title image, no extended image, and uAlign==LVGA_HEADER_CENTER.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.cchDescriptionBottom
member.summary: Windows Vista. Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszDescriptionBottom member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.iTitleImage
member.summary: Windows Vista. Index of the title image in the control imagelist.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.iExtendedImage
member.summary: Windows Vista. Index of the extended image in the control imagelist.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.iFirstItem
member.summary: Windows Vista. Read-only.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.cItems
member.summary: Windows Vista. Read-only in non-owner data mode.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.pszSubsetTitle
member.summary: Windows Vista. NULL if group is not a subset. Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the subset title text when item information is being set. If group information is being retrieved, this member specifies the address of the buffer that receives the subset title text.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.ListViewControl.LVGROUP_VISTA.cchSubsetTitle
member.summary: Windows Vista. Size in TCHARs of the buffer pointed to by the pszSubsetTitle member. If the structure is not receiving information about a group, this member is ignored.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.MouseInput.EventFlags
member.summary: Flags for the mouse event.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.EventFlags.TME_CANCEL
member.summary: The caller wants to cancel a prior tracking request. The caller should also specify the type of tracking that it wants to cancel. For example, to cancel hover tracking, the caller must pass the TME_CANCEL and TME_HOVER flags.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.EventFlags.TME_HOVER
member.summary: The caller wants hover notification. Notification is delivered as a WM_MOUSEHOVER message. If the caller requests hover tracking while hover tracking is already active, the hover timer will be reset. This flag is ignored if the mouse pointer is not over the specified window or area.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.EventFlags.TME_LEAVE
member.summary: The caller wants leave notification. Notification is delivered as a WM_MOUSELEAVE message. If the mouse is not over the specified window or area, a leave notification is generated immediately and no further tracking is performed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.EventFlags.TME_NONCLIENT
member.summary: The caller wants hover and leave notification for the nonclient areas. Notification is delivered as WM_NCMOUSEHOVER and WM_NCMOUSELEAVE messages.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.EventFlags.TME_QUERY
member.summary: The function fills in the structure instead of treating it as a tracking request. The structure is filled such that had that structure been passed to TrackMouseEvent, it would generate the current tracking.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.MouseInput.MouseActivate
member.summary: Return values for WM_MOUSEACTIVATE message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.MouseActivate.MA_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates the window, and does not discard the mouse message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.MouseActivate.MA_ACTIVATEANDEAT
member.summary: Activates the window, and discards the mouse message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.MouseActivate.MA_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window, and does not discard the mouse message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.MouseActivate.MA_NOACTIVATEANDEAT
member.summary: Does not activate the window, but discards the mouse message.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.MouseInput.TRACKMOUSEEVENT
member.summary: Used by the TrackMouseEvent function to track when the mouse pointer leaves a window or hovers over a window for a specified amount of time.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.TRACKMOUSEEVENT.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the TRACKMOUSEEVENT structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.TRACKMOUSEEVENT.dwFlags
member.summary: The services requested.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.TRACKMOUSEEVENT.hwndTrack
member.summary: A handle to the window to track.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.MouseInput.TRACKMOUSEEVENT.dwHoverTime
member.summary: The hover time-out (if TME_HOVER was specified in dwFlags), in milliseconds. default is 400.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType
member.summary: wParam values for WM_POWERBROADCAST message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMPOWERSTATUSCHANGE
member.summary: Power status has changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMRESUMEAUTOMATIC
member.summary: Operation is resuming automatically from a low-power state. This message is sent every time the system resumes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMRESUMESUSPEND
member.summary: Operation is resuming from a low-power state. This message is sent after PBT_APMRESUMEAUTOMATIC if the resume is triggered by user input, such as pressing a key.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMSUSPEND
member.summary: System is suspending operation.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_POWERSETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: A power setting change event has been received.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMBATTERYLOW
member.summary: Battery power is low. In Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista, use PBT_APMPOWERSTATUSCHANGE instead.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMOEMEVENT
member.summary: OEM-defined event occurred. In Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista, this event is not available because these operating systems support only ACPI; APM BIOS events are not supported.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMQUERYSUSPEND
member.summary: Request for permission to suspend. In Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista, use the SetThreadExecutionState function instead.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMQUERYSUSPENDFAILED
member.summary: Suspension request denied. In Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista, use SetThreadExecutionState instead.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.PowerManagement.PowerBroadcastType.PBT_APMRESUMECRITICAL
member.summary: Operation resuming after critical suspension. In Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista, use PBT_APMRESUMEAUTOMATIC instead.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles
member.summary: Class style flags for a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_VREDRAW
member.summary: Redraws the entire window if a movement or size adjustment changes the height of the client area.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_HREDRAW
member.summary: Redraws the entire window if a movement or size adjustment changes the width of the client area.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_DBLCLKS
member.summary: Sends a double-click message to the window procedure when the user double-clicks the mouse while the cursor is within a window belonging to the class.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_OWNDC
member.summary: Allocates a unique device context for each window in the class.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_CLASSDC
member.summary: Allocates one device context to be shared by all windows in the class.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_PARENTDC
member.summary: Sets the clipping rectangle of the child window to that of the parent window so that the child can draw on the parent.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_NOCLOSE
member.summary: Disables Close on the window menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_SAVEBITS
member.summary: Saves, as a bitmap, the portion of the screen image obscured by a window of this class. When the window is removed, the system uses the saved bitmap to restore the screen image, including other windows that were obscured.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_BYTEALIGNCLIENT
member.summary: Aligns the window's client area on a byte boundary (in the x direction). This style affects the width of the window and its horizontal placement on the display.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_BYTEALIGNWINDOW
member.summary: Aligns the window on a byte boundary (in the x direction). This style affects the width of the window and its horizontal placement on the display.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_GLOBALCLASS
member.summary: Indicates that the window class is an application global class.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ClassStyles.CS_DROPSHADOW
member.summary: Enables the drop shadow effect on a window. The effect is turned on and off through SPI_SETDROPSHADOW.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.MINMAXINFO.ptReserved
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: The maximized width (x member) and the maximized height (y member) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: The position of the left side of the maximized window (x member) and the position of the top of the maximized window (y member). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: The minimum tracking width (x member) and the minimum tracking height (y member) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK (see the GetSystemMetrics function).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: The maximum tracking width (x member) and the maximum tracking height (y member) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK (see the GetSystemMetrics function).

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults
member.summary: Values for possible WM_NCCALCSIZE message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_ALIGNTOP
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the top of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the upper-left corner, return the WVR_ALIGNTOP and WVR_ALIGNLEFT values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_ALIGNLEFT
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the left side of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the lower-left corner, return the WVR_ALIGNLEFT and WVR_ALIGNBOTTOM values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_ALIGNBOTTOM
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the bottom of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the top-left corner, return the WVR_ALIGNTOP and WVR_ALIGNLEFT values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_ALIGNRIGHT
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the right side of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the lower-right corner, return the WVR_ALIGNRIGHT and WVR_ALIGNBOTTOM values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_HREDRAW
member.summary: Used in combination with any other values, except WVR_VALIDRECTS, causes the window to be completely redrawn if the client rectangle changes size horizontally. This value is similar to CS_HREDRAW class style

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_VREDRAW
member.summary: Used in combination with any other values, except WVR_VALIDRECTS, causes the window to be completely redrawn if the client rectangle changes size vertically. This value is similar to CS_VREDRAW class style

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_REDRAW
member.summary: This value causes the entire window to be redrawn. It is a combination of WVR_HREDRAW and WVR_VREDRAW values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcCalcResults.WVR_VALIDRECTS
member.summary: This value indicates that, upon return from WM_NCCALCSIZE, the rectangles specified by the rgrc[1] and rgrc[2] members of the NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS structure contain valid destination and source area rectangles, respectively. The system combines these rectangles to calculate the area of the window to be preserved. The system copies any part of the window image that is within the source rectangle and clips the image to the destination rectangle. Both rectangles are in parent-relative or screen-relative coordinates. This flag cannot be combined with any other flags. This return value allows an application to implement more elaborate client-area preservation strategies, such as centering or preserving a subset of the client area.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS
member.summary: Contains information that an application can use while processing the WM_NCCALCSIZE message to calculate the size, position, and valid contents of the client area of a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectProposed
member.summary: Contains the new coordinates of a window that has been moved or resized, that is, it is the proposed new window coordinates.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectBeforeMove
member.summary: Contains the coordinates of the window before it was moved or resized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectClientBeforeMove
member.summary: Contains the coordinates of the window's client area before the window was moved or resized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.lpPos
member.summary: Pointer to a WINDOWPOS structure that contains the size and position values specified in the operation that moved or resized the window.

member.summary: In a Minimize button.

member.summary: In a Maximize button.

member.summary: In the left border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.NcHitTest.HTRIGHT
