member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions
member.summary: Flags for the window position.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores the x and y parameters).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hwndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hwndInsertAfter member).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window. Same as the SWP_FRAMECHANGED flag.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order. Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SetWindowPosOptions.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption
member.summary: Options for ShowWindow option.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.ShowWindowOption.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand
member.summary: Parameter for WM_SYSCOMMAND.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_SIZE
member.summary: Sizes the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_MOVE
member.summary: Moves the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_MAXIMIZE2
member.summary: fired from double-click on caption

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_NEXTWINDOW
member.summary: Moves to the next window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_PREVWINDOW
member.summary: Moves to the previous window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_CLOSE
member.summary: Closes the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_VSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls vertically.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_HSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls horizontally.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_MOUSEMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a mouse click.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_KEYMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_RESTORE
member.summary: Restores the window to its normal position and size.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_RESTORE2
member.summary: fired from double-click on caption

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_TASKLIST
member.summary: Activates the Start menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_SCREENSAVE
member.summary: Executes the screen saver application.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_HOTKEY
member.summary: Activates the window associated with the application-specified hot key. The lParam parameter identifies the window to activate.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_DEFAULT
member.summary: Selects the default item; the user double-clicked the window menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_MONITORPOWER
member.summary: Sets the state of the display. This command supports devices that have power-saving features, such as a battery-powered personal computer.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.SystemCommand.SC_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Changes the cursor to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage
member.summary: Enumerated values of window messages.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NULL
member.summary: Performs no operation. An application sends the WM_NULL message if it wants to post a message that the recipient window will ignore.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CREATE
member.summary: Sent when an application requests that a window be created by calling the CreateWindowEx or CreateWindow function. (The message is sent before the function returns.) The window procedure of the new window receives this message after the window is created, but before the window becomes visible.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DESTROY
member.summary: Sent when a window is being destroyed. It is sent to the window procedure of the window being destroyed after the window is removed from the screen. This message is sent first to the window being destroyed and then to the child windows (if any) as they are destroyed. During the processing of the message, it can be assumed that all child windows still exist.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOVE
member.summary: Sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SIZE
member.summary: Sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Sent to both the window being activated and the window being deactivated. If the windows use the same input queue, the message is sent synchronously, first to the window procedure of the top-level window being deactivated, then to the window procedure of the top-level window being activated. If the windows use different input queues, the message is sent asynchronously, so the window is activated immediately.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETFOCUS
member.summary: Sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_KILLFOCUS
member.summary: Sent to a window immediately before it loses the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ENABLE
member.summary: Sent when an application changes the enabled state of a window. It is sent to the window whose enabled state is changing. This message is sent before the EnableWindow function returns, but after the enabled state (WS_DISABLED style bit) of the window has changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETREDRAW message to a window to allow changes in that window to be redrawn or to prevent changes in that window from being redrawn.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETTEXT
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETTEXT
member.summary: Copies the text that corresponds to a window into a buffer provided by the caller.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETTEXTLENGTH
member.summary: Determines the length, in characters, of the text associated with a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PAINT
member.summary: The WM_PAINT message is sent when the system or another application makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window. The message is sent when the UpdateWindow or RedrawWindow function is called, or by the DispatchMessage function when the application obtains a WM_PAINT message by using the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CLOSE
member.summary: Sent as a signal that a window or an application should terminate.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUERYENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_QUERYENDSESSION message is sent when the user chooses to end the session or when an application calls one of the system shutdown functions. If any application returns zero, the session is not ended. The system stops sending WM_QUERYENDSESSION messages as soon as one application returns zero. After processing this message, the system sends the WM_ENDSESSION message with the wParam parameter set to the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUIT
member.summary: Indicates a request to terminate an application, and is generated when the application calls the PostQuitMessage function. This message causes the GetMessage function to return zero.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUERYOPEN
member.summary: Sent to an icon when the user requests that the window be restored to its previous size and position.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ERASEBKGND
member.summary: Sent when the window background must be erased (for example, when a window is resized). The message is sent to prepare an invalidated portion of a window for painting.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows when a change is made to a system color setting.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_ENDSESSION message is sent to an application after the system processes the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message. The WM_ENDSESSION message informs the application whether the session is ending.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLOR
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLOR message is used in 16-bit versions of Windows to change the color scheme of list boxes, the list boxes of combo boxes, message boxes, button controls, edit controls, static controls, and dialog boxes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent to all top-level windows when the SystemParametersInfo function changes a system-wide setting or when policy settings have changed. Applications should send WM_SETTINGCHANGE to all top-level windows when they make changes to system parameters. (This message cannot be sent directly to a window.) To send the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message to all top-level windows, use the SendMessageTimeout function with the hwnd parameter set to HWND_BROADCAST.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DEVMODECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVMODECHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows whenever the user changes device-mode settings.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ACTIVATEAPP
member.summary: Sent when a window belonging to a different application than the active window is about to be activated. The message is sent to the application whose window is being activated and to the application whose window is being deactivated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_FONTCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_FONTCHANGE message to all top-level windows in the system after changing the pool of font resources.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_TIMECHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent whenever there is a change in the system time.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CANCELMODE
member.summary: Sent to cancel certain modes, such as mouse capture. For example, the system sends this message to the active window when a dialog box or message box is displayed. Certain functions also send this message explicitly to the specified window regardless of whether it is the active window. For example, the EnableWindow function sends this message when disabling the specified window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETCURSOR
member.summary: Sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOUSEACTIVATE
member.summary: Sent when the cursor is in an inactive window and the user presses a mouse button. The parent window receives this message only if the child window passes it to the DefWindowProc function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CHILDACTIVATE
member.summary: Sent to a child window when the user clicks the window's title bar or when the window is activated, moved, or sized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUEUESYNC
member.summary: Sent by a computer-based training (CBT) application to separate user-input messages from other messages sent through the WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK procedure.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: Sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change. An application can use this message to override the window's default maximized size and position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NEXTDLGCTL
member.summary: Sent to a dialog box procedure to set the keyboard focus to a different control in the dialog box.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SPOOLERSTATUS
member.summary: The WM_SPOOLERSTATUS message is sent from Print Manager whenever a job is added to or removed from the Print Manager queue.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DRAWITEM
member.summary: Sent to the parent window of an owner-drawn button, combo box, list box, or menu when a visual aspect of the button, combo box, list box, or menu has changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MEASUREITEM
member.summary: Sent to the owner window of a combo box, list box, list view control, or menu item when the control or menu is created.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DELETEITEM
member.summary: Sent to the owner of a list box or combo box when the list box or combo box is destroyed or when items are removed by the LB_DELETESTRING, LB_RESETCONTENT, CB_DELETESTRING, or CB_RESETCONTENT message. The system sends a WM_DELETEITEM message for each deleted item. The system sends the WM_DELETEITEM message for any deleted list box or combo box item with nonzero item data.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_VKEYTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CHARTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_CHAR message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETFONT
member.summary: Sets the font that a control is to use when drawing text.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETFONT
member.summary: Retrieves the font with which the control is currently drawing its text.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETHOTKEY
member.summary: Sent to a window to associate a hot key with the window. When the user presses the hot key, the system activates the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETHOTKEY
member.summary: Sent to determine the hot key associated with a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUERYDRAGICON
member.summary: Sent to a minimized (iconic) window. The window is about to be dragged by the user but does not have an icon defined for its class. An application can return a handle to an icon or cursor. The system displays this cursor or icon while the user drags the icon.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_COMPAREITEM
member.summary: Sent to determine the relative position of a new item in the sorted list of an owner-drawn combo box or list box. Whenever the application adds a new item, the system sends this message to the owner of a combo box or list box created with the CBS_SORT or LBS_SORT style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETOBJECT
member.summary: Sent by both Microsoft Active Accessibility and Microsoft UI Automation to obtain information about an accessible object contained in a server application. Applications never send this message directly. Microsoft Active Accessibility sends this message in response to calls to AccessibleObjectFromPoint, AccessibleObjectFromEvent, or AccessibleObjectFromWindow. However, server applications handle this message. UI Automation sends this message in response to calls to IUIAutomation::ElementFromHandle, ElementFromPoint, and GetFocusedElement, and when handling events for which a client has registered.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_COMPACTING
member.summary: Sent to all top-level windows when the system detects more than 12.5 percent of system time over a 30- to 60-second interval is being spent compacting memory. This indicates that system memory is low.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: Sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_COPYDATA
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPYDATA message to pass data to another application.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CANCELJOURNAL
member.summary: Posted to an application when a user cancels the application's journaling activities. The message is posted with a NULL window handle.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NOTIFY
member.summary: Sent by a common control to its parent window when an event has occurred or the control requires some information.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST
member.summary: Posted to the window with the focus when the user chooses a new input language, either with the hotkey (specified in the Keyboard control panel application) or from the indicator on the system taskbar. An application can accept the change by passing the message to the DefWindowProc function or reject the change (and prevent it from taking place) by returning immediately.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE
member.summary: Sent to the topmost affected window after an application's input language has been changed. You should make any application-specific settings and pass the message to the DefWindowProc function, which passes the message to all first-level child windows. These child windows can pass the message to DefWindowProc to have it pass the message to their child windows, and so on.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_TCARD
member.summary: Sent to an application that has initiated a training card with Windows Help. The message informs the application when the user clicks an authorable button. An application initiates a training card by specifying the HELP_TCARD command in a call to the WinHelp function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_HELP
member.summary: Indicates that the user pressed the F1 key. If a menu is active when F1 is pressed, WM_HELP is sent to the window associated with the menu; otherwise, WM_HELP is sent to the window that has the keyboard focus. If no window has the keyboard focus, WM_HELP is sent to the currently active window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_USERCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all windows after the user has logged on or off. When the user logs on or off, the system updates the user-specific settings. The system sends this message immediately after updating the settings.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NOTIFYFORMAT
member.summary: Determines if a window accepts ANSI or Unicode structures in the WM_NOTIFY notification message. WM_NOTIFYFORMAT messages are sent from a common control to its parent window and from the parent window to the common control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CONTEXTMENU
member.summary: Notifies a window that the user clicked the right mouse button (right-clicked) in the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_STYLECHANGING
member.summary: Sent to a window when the SetWindowLong function is about to change one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_STYLECHANGED
member.summary: Sent to a window after the SetWindowLong function has changed one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DISPLAYCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DISPLAYCHANGE message is sent to all windows when the display resolution has changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETICON
member.summary: Sent to a window to retrieve a handle to the large or small icon associated with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SETICON
member.summary: Associates a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCCREATE
member.summary: Sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCDESTROY
member.summary: Notifies a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed. The DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY message.WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. The WM_NCDESTROY message is sent after the child windows have been destroyed. In contrast, WM_DESTROY is sent before the child windows are destroyed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: Sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated. By processing this message, an application can control the content of the window's client area when the size or position of the window changes.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCHITTEST
member.summary: Sent to a window in order to determine what part of the window corresponds to a particular screen coordinate. This can happen, for example, when the cursor moves, when a mouse button is pressed or released, or in response to a call to a function such as WindowFromPoint. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_NCPAINT message is sent to a window when its frame must be painted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCACTIVATE
member.summary: Sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETDLGCODE
member.summary: Sent to the window procedure associated with a control. By default, the system handles all keyboard input to the control; the system interprets certain types of keyboard input as dialog box navigation keys. To override this default behavior, the control can respond to the WM_GETDLGCODE message to indicate the types of input it wants to process itself.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYNCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_SYNCPAINT message is used to synchronize painting while avoiding linking independent GUI threads.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCMOUSEMOVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor is moved within the nonclient area of the window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCLBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCMBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCXBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCXBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCUAHDRAWCAPTION
member.summary: Undocumented value that needs to be suppressed in custom drawn form.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCUAHDRAWFRAME
member.summary: Undocumented value that needs to be suppressed in custom drawn form.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_KEYDOWN
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_KEYUP
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CHAR
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_CHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DEADCHAR
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYUP message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_DEADCHAR specifies a character code generated by a dead key. A dead key is a key that generates a character, such as the umlaut (double-dot), that is combined with another character to form a composite character. For example, the umlaut-O character () is generated by typing the dead key for the umlaut character, and then typing the O key.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYSKEYUP
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYSCHAR
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYSDEADCHAR
member.summary: Sent to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_SYSDEADCHAR specifies the character code of a system dead key that is, a dead key that is pressed while holding down the ALT key.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_UNICHAR
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_UNICHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed. The WM_UNICHAR message is equivalent to WM_CHAR, but it uses Unicode Transformation Format (UTF)-32, whereas WM_CHAR uses UTF-16. It is designed to send or post Unicode characters to ANSI windows and it can can handle Unicode Supplementary Plane characters.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION
member.summary: Sent immediately before the IME generates the composition string as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_ENDCOMPOSITION
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME ends composition.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_COMPOSITION
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME changes composition status as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_INITDIALOG
member.summary: Sent to the dialog box procedure immediately before a dialog box is displayed. Dialog box procedures typically use this message to initialize controls and carry out any other initialization tasks that affect the appearance of the dialog box.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_COMMAND
member.summary: Sent when the user selects a command item from a menu, when a control sends a notification message to its parent window, or when an accelerator keystroke is translated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_TIMER
member.summary: Posted to the installing thread's message queue when a timer expires.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_HSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard horizontal scroll bar. This message is also sent to the owner of a horizontal scroll bar control when a scroll event occurs in the control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_VSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard vertical scroll bar. This message is also sent to the owner of a vertical scroll bar control when a scroll event occurs in the control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_INITMENU
member.summary: Sent when a menu is about to become active. It occurs when the user clicks an item on the menu bar or presses a menu key. This allows the application to modify the menu before it is displayed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_INITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: Sent when a drop-down menu or submenu is about to become active. This allows an application to modify the menu before it is displayed, without changing the entire menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MENUSELECT
member.summary: Sent to a menu's owner window when the user selects a menu item.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MENUCHAR
member.summary: Sent when a menu is active and the user presses a key that does not correspond to any mnemonic or accelerator key. This message is sent to the window that owns the menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ENTERIDLE
member.summary: Sent to the owner window of a modal dialog box or menu that is entering an idle state. A modal dialog box or menu enters an idle state when no messages are waiting in its queue after it has processed one or more previous messages.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MENURBUTTONUP
member.summary: Sent when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is on a menu item.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MENUDRAG
member.summary: Sent to the owner of a drag-and-drop menu when the user drags a menu item.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MENUGETOBJECT
member.summary: Sent to the owner of a drag-and-drop menu when the mouse cursor enters a menu item or moves from the center of the item to the top or bottom of the item.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_UNINITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: Sent when a drop-down menu or submenu has been destroyed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MENUCOMMAND
member.summary: Sent when the user makes a selection from a menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CHANGEUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_CHANGEUISTATE message to indicate that the UI state should be changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_UPDATEUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_UPDATEUISTATE message to change the UI state for the specified window and all its child windows.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUERYUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_QUERYUISTATE message to retrieve the UI state for a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLOREDIT
member.summary: An edit control that is not read-only or disabled sends the WM_CTLCOLOREDIT message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the specified device context handle to set the text and background colors of the edit control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLORLISTBOX
member.summary: Sent to the parent window of a list box before the system draws the list box. By responding to this message, the parent window can set the text and background colors of the list box by using the specified display device context handle.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLORBTN
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORBTN message is sent to the parent window of a button before drawing the button. The parent window can change the button's text and background colors. However, only owner-drawn buttons respond to the parent window processing this message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLORDLG
member.summary: Sent to a dialog box before the system draws the dialog box. By responding to this message, the dialog box can set its text and background colors using the specified display device context handle.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR message is sent to the parent window of a scroll bar control when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the display context handle to set the background color of the scroll bar control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC
member.summary: A static control, or an edit control that is read-only or disabled, sends the WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the specified device context handle to set the text and background colors of the static control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_LBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_LBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_RBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: Sent to the focus window when the mouse wheel is rotated. The DefWindowProc function propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chain until it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_XBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_XBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOUSEHWHEEL
member.summary: Sent to the active window when the mouse's horizontal scroll wheel is tilted or rotated. The DefWindowProc function propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chain until it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Sent to the parent of a child window when the child window is created or destroyed, or when the user clicks a mouse button while the cursor is over the child window. When the child window is being created, the system sends WM_PARENTNOTIFY just before the CreateWindow or CreateWindowEx function that creates the window returns. When the child window is being destroyed, the system sends the message before any processing to destroy the window takes place.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ENTERMENULOOP
member.summary: Notifies an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been entered.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_EXITMENULOOP
member.summary: Notifies an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been entered.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NEXTMENU
member.summary: Sent to an application when the right or left arrow key is used to switch between the menu bar and the system menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SIZING
member.summary: Sent to a window that the user is resizing. By processing this message, an application can monitor the size and position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its size or position.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CAPTURECHANGED
member.summary: Sent to the window that is losing the mouse capture.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOVING
member.summary: Sent to a window that the user is moving. By processing this message, an application can monitor the position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its position.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_POWERBROADCAST
member.summary: Notifies applications that a power-management event has occurred.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DEVICECHANGE
member.summary: Notifies an application of a change to the hardware configuration of a device or the computer.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDICREATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICREATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to create an MDI child window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIDESTROY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIDESTROY message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to close an MDI child window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIACTIVATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIACTIVATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to instruct the client window to activate a different MDI child window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIRESTORE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIRESTORE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to restore an MDI child window from maximized or minimized size.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDINEXT
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDINEXT message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to activate the next or previous child window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIMAXIMIZE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIMAXIMIZE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to maximize an MDI child window. The system resizes the child window to make its client area fill the client window. The system places the child window's window menu icon in the rightmost position of the frame window's menu bar, and places the child window's restore icon in the leftmost position. The system also appends the title bar text of the child window to that of the frame window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDITILE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDITILE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all of its MDI child windows in a tile format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDICASCADE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICASCADE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all its child windows in a cascade format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIICONARRANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIICONARRANGE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all minimized MDI child windows. It does not affect child windows that are not minimized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIGETACTIVE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIGETACTIVE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to retrieve the handle to the active MDI child window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDISETMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDISETMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to replace the entire menu of an MDI frame window, to replace the window menu of the frame window, or both.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE
member.summary: Sent one time to a window after it enters the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns. The system sends the WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message regardless of whether the dragging of full windows is enabled.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_EXITSIZEMOVE
member.summary: Sent one time to a window, after it has exited the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DROPFILES
member.summary: Sent when the user drops a file on the window of an application that has registered itself as a recipient of dropped files.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MDIREFRESHMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIREFRESHMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to refresh the window menu of the MDI frame window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_NOTIFY
member.summary: Sent to an application to notify it of changes to the IME window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_CONTROL
member.summary: Sent by an application to direct the IME window to carry out the requested command. The application uses this message to control the IME window that it has created. To send this message, the application calls the SendMessage function with the following parameters.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_COMPOSITIONFULL
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME window finds no space to extend the area for the composition window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_SELECT
member.summary: Sent to an application when the operating system is about to change the current IME.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_CHAR
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME gets a character of the conversion result.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_REQUEST
member.summary: Sent to an application to provide commands and request information.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_KEYDOWN
member.summary: Sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key press and to keep message order.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_IME_KEYUP
member.summary: Sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key release and to keep message order.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCMOUSEHOVER
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the nonclient area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOUSEHOVER
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the client area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_NCMOUSELEAVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor leaves the nonclient area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_MOUSELEAVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor leaves the client area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DPICHANGED
member.summary: Sent when a window's position changes such that most of its area intersects a monitor with a dots per inch (dpi) that is different from the DPI before the position change.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CUT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CUT message to an edit control or combo box to delete (cut) the current selection, if any, in the edit control and copy the deleted text to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_COPY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPY message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current selection to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PASTE
member.summary: An application sends a WM_PASTE message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current content of the clipboard to the edit control at the current caret position. Data is inserted only if the clipboard contains data in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CLEAR
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CLEAR message to an edit control or combo box to delete (clear) the current selection, if any, from the edit control.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_UNDO
member.summary: An application sends a WM_UNDO message to an edit control to undo the last operation. When this message is sent to an edit control, the previously deleted text is restored or the previously added text is deleted.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_RENDERFORMAT
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner if it has delayed rendering a specific clipboard format and if an application has requested data in that format. The clipboard owner must render data in the specified format and place it on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_RENDERALLFORMATS
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner before it is destroyed, if the clipboard owner has delayed rendering one or more clipboard formats. For the content of the clipboard to remain available to other applications, the clipboard owner must render data in all the formats it is capable of generating, and place the data on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD
member.summary: ent to the clipboard owner when a call to the EmptyClipboard function empties the clipboard.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD
member.summary: Sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when the content of the clipboard changes. This enables a clipboard viewer window to display the new content of the clipboard.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area needs repainting.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's vertical scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_SIZECLIPBOARD
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area has changed size.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window to request the name of a CF_OWNERDISPLAY clipboard format.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CHANGECBCHAIN
member.summary: Sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when a window is being removed from the chain.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window. This occurs when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's horizontal scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE
member.summary: The WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE message informs a window that it is about to receive the keyboard focus, giving the window the opportunity to realize its logical palette when it receives the focus.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PALETTEISCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_PALETTEISCHANGING message informs applications that an application is going to realize its logical palette.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PALETTECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_PALETTECHANGED message is sent to all top-level and overlapped windows after the window with the keyboard focus has realized its logical palette, thereby changing the system palette. This message enables a window that uses a color palette but does not have the keyboard focus to realize its logical palette and update its client area.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_HOTKEY
member.summary: Posted when the user presses a hot key registered by the RegisterHotKey function. The message is placed at the top of the message queue associated with the thread that registered the hot key.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_POPUPSYSTEMMENU
member.summary: Undocumented message to show system menu.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PRINT
member.summary: The WM_PRINT message is sent to a window to request that it draw itself in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_PRINTCLIENT
member.summary: The WM_PRINTCLIENT message is sent to a window to request that it draw its client area in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context. Unlike WM_PRINT, WM_PRINTCLIENT is not processed by DefWindowProc. A window should process the WM_PRINTCLIENT message through an application-defined WindowProc function for it to be used properly.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_APPCOMMAND
member.summary: Notifies a window that the user generated an application command event, for example, by clicking an application command button using the mouse or typing an application command key on the keyboard.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_THEMECHANGED
member.summary: Broadcast to every window following a theme change event. Examples of theme change events are the activation of a theme, the deactivation of a theme, or a transition from one theme to another.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_CLIPBOARDUPDATE
member.summary: Sent when the contents of the clipboard have changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all top-level windows when Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition has been enabled or disabled.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DWMNCRENDERINGCHANGED
member.summary: Sent when the non-client area rendering policy has changed. DwmGetWindowAttribute and DwmSetWindowAttribute are used to get or set the non-client rendering policy specified by the DWMNCRENDERINGPOLICY enumeration.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DWMCOLORIZATIONCOLORCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all top-level windows when the colorization color has changed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_DWMWINDOWMAXIMIZEDCHANGE
member.summary: Sent when a Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composed window is maximized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowMessage.WM_GETTITLEBARINFOEX
member.summary: Sent to request extended title bar information.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT
member.summary: Contains information about the placement of a window on the screen.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT.length
member.summary: The length of the structure, in bytes. Before calling the GetWindowPlacement or SetWindowPlacement functions, set this member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT.flags
member.summary: The flags that control the position of the minimized window and the method by which the window is restored.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT.showCmd
member.summary: The current show state of the window. This member can be one of the following values.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT.ptMinPosition
member.summary: The coordinates of the window's upper-left corner when the window is minimized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: The coordinates of the window's upper-left corner when the window is maximized.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPLACEMENT.rcNormalPosition
member.summary: The window's coordinates when the window is in the restored position.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowPlacementFlags.WPF_SETMINPOSITION
member.summary: The coordinates of the minimized window may be specified. This flag must be specified if the coordinates are set in the ptMinPosition member.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowPlacementFlags.WPF_RESTORETOMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The restored window will be maximized, regardless of whether it was maximized before it was minimized. This setting is only valid the next time the window is restored. It does not change the default restoration behavior. This flag is only valid when the SW_SHOWMINIMIZED value is specified for the showCmd member.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowPlacementFlags.WPF_ASYNCWINDOWPLACEMENT
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS
member.summary: Contains information about the size and position of a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.hwnd
member.summary: Handle to the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.hWndInsertAfter
member.summary: Specifies the position of the window in Z order (front-to-back position). This member can be a handle to the window behind which this window is placed, or can be one of the special values listed with the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.x
member.summary: Specifies the position of the left edge of the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.y
member.summary: Specifies the position of the top edge of the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.cx
member.summary: Specifies the window width, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.cy
member.summary: Specifies the window height, in pixels.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.flags
member.summary: Specifies the window position.

member.name: M:CommonWin32.Windows.WINDOWPOS.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles
member.summary: Style flags for a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window usually has a caption and a border.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. Cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. Cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. For use with the WS_OVERLAPPED style only.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a paint message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapped child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. (If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not given and child windows overlap, when you draw within the client area of a child window, it is possible to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.) For use with the WS_CHILD style only.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when you draw within the parent window. Used when you create the parent window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window of maximum size.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (implies the WS_BORDER style). Cannot be used with the WS_DLGFRAME style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window with a double border but no title.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Control-menu box in its title bar. Used only for windows with title bars.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window with a thick frame that can be used to size the window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls in which the user can move from one control to the next with the arrow keys. All controls defined with the WS_GROUP style FALSE after the first control belong to the same group. The next control with the WS_GROUP style starts the next group (that is, one group ends where the next begins).

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies one of any number of controls through which the user can move by using the TAB key. The TAB key moves the user to the next control specified by the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Minimize button.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Maximize button.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_TILED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_ICONIC
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the WS_OVERLAPPED, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, and WS_MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the WS_OVERLAPPED, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, and WS_MAXIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window with the WS_BORDER, WS_POPUP, and WS_SYSMENU styles. The WS_CAPTION style must be combined with the WS_POPUPWINDOW style to make the Control menu visible.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStyles.WS_CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: T:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx
member.summary: Extended style flags for a window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Designates a window with a double border that may (optionally) be created with a title bar when you specify the WS_CAPTION style flag in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style will not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when the child window is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all nontopmost windows and stay above them even when the window is deactivated. An application can use the SetWindowPos member function to add or remove this attribute.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style accepts drag-and-drop files.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style is to be transparent. That is, any windows that are beneath the window are not obscured by the window. A window created with this style receives WM_PAINT messages only after all sibling windows beneath it have been updated.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates an MDI child window.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window, which is a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the task bar or in the window that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a 3D look that is, a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: Gives a window generic right-aligned properties. This depends on the window class.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Gives window generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: Displays the window text using right-to-left reading order properties.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: Displays the window text using left-to-right reading order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Places a vertical scroll bar to the left of the client area.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Places a vertical scroll bar (if present) to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: Allows the user to navigate among the child windows of the window by using the TAB key.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE and WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE styles

member.name: F:CommonWin32.Windows.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE and WS_EX_TOPMOST styles.
